title: Closed-loop system disturbance recovery.
abstract: NoThe regulation of linearized multivariable system models, following input set point and load disturbance changes, is considered. An inner and outer closed-loop control strategy is outlined, enabling targeted recovery rates, offset attenuation and low steady state interaction to be achieved. Proportional control and passive network compensation alone are employed. Gain ratio selection and outer loop tuning are exercised, ensuring thereby the confinement of output perturbations to low-frequency load disturbances and reference input changes. Application studies are presented for purposes of comparison

The regulation of linearized multivariable system models, following input set point and load disturbance changes, is considered. An inner and outer closed-loop control strategy is outlined, enabling targeted recovery rates, offset attenuation and low steady state interaction to be achieved. Proportional control and passive network compensation alone are employed. Gain ratio selection and outer loop tuning are exercised, ensuring thereby the confinement of output perturbations to low-frequency load disturbances and reference input changes.
